NSGIA Memory System: Roadmap and Launch-Ready Overview
Abstract
The NSGIA Memory System is a fully developed, token-efficient platform enabling persistent cross-chat memory for AI assistants. Leveraging temporary static HTML pages, secure authentication, and modular prompt templates, the system allows users to store, share, and retrieve contextual knowledge efficiently. This document describes the completed architecture, freemium and paid tiers, and the systemâ€™s readiness for release to early adopters.

1. Introduction
Artificial intelligence assistants are traditionally limited by ephemeral interactions and small context windows. The NSGIA Memory System resolves these limitations by providing:

Persistent memory via user-uploaded chats, documents, and prompts.

Token-efficient sharing with AI assistants through temporary static HTML pages.

Modular prompt templates for consistent style, tone, and workflow instructions.

Secure access with tiered authentication for free and paid users.

The MVP has been fully implemented, tested, and is now ready for public deployment.

2. Completed Features
2.1 Temporary Pages
Users can create static HTML pages containing chats, documents, or prompt templates.

Pages are optimized for AI web tools and include unique URLs.

Pages expire automatically (default 15 minutes) to balance usability and security.

Pages include branding to ensure each shared page serves as a subtle promotion.

2.2 AI Integration
AI assistants can fetch and parse temp pages directly, avoiding high token costs.

Users can share pages across multiple AI platforms or with colleagues.

2.3 User Authentication
Freemium users: Simple email/password login with persistent data and limited temp pages per month.

Paid users: Device-bound two-factor authentication using QR/image-based login for sensitive content.
